TopicTitle: Looking at my school clubs for next year and found this

Articles.Content:
![2akczjJ.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/2akczjJ.jpg)

Wow I'm going next year

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-12T22:29:39Z" title="05/12/2015 10:29  PM" data-short="9 yr">May 12, 2015</time> by Vanamonde**
  
Extra "M"

Wow, so jealous.

EDIT: Wasn't sarcasm.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-12T20:58:47Z" title="05/12/2015 08:58  PM" data-short="9 yr">May 12, 2015</time> by Spartwo**
I can't belive this man....

Nice. Games that are both fun and educational always draw the attention school clubs like this. Even Minecraft did, which had it's moments but was far less educational than KSP. There will likely be a lot of this now that Kerbal EDU and 1.0 are here.
Cool, my school dont let us do anything fun bar one day of the year, enjoy it and show off, or better yet ask the teacher if you can tell people how to play.

Minecraft used to be my main game to play. Like 24/7

But then my uncle gave me KSP and I loved it.

Still really hyped for next year

Darn!

they didn't have this at my school

u r lucky

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-12T22:37:03Z" title="05/12/2015 10:37  PM" data-short="9 yr">May 12, 2015</time> by Master Tao**

Lucky as can be!

![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

- - - Updated - - -

When I was in 6th grade my dad grounded me for the whole school year..

But today he ungrounded me!
Our school rejected our smash club and you have a KERBAL CLUB?? Lucky! I'll be in college next year so it doesn't really matter anyways. I hope you have fun!

GOD DANG IT I'M MOVING

uncapsplz

Avea9eJoe: Gonna have fun!

Thomas988: Dude, Internet rules. Can't tell you where I live or go to school.

@KrizzGaming: Nice, lucky you. Wish they had that when I was in school...of course, didn't have KSP back then either. Each meeting/event, you should end it with DasValdez's "Later NERDS!" ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

> 
> Lucky as can be!
> ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
> 
> - - - Updated - - -
> 
> When I was in 6th grade my dad grounded me for the whole school year..
> 
> But today he ungrounded me!

What did you do to get grounded that long!?!?

Back when I was in 8th grade, we didn't have these fancy video programs to simulate a space program. All we could do was count down from 10 and throw rocks as high in the air as we could. The rocks usually didn't make it into orbit, and they regularly fell back down and hit one of us in the head. Space travel was rough back then.

Aww, this sounds so fun!

Maybe I can get one for my school. I know the principal pretty darn well, and I told her about KSP once...

And no, I don't know her because I'm a troublemaker, it's robotics business. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

My private school next year has an ISS/Space Program elective where we build an experiment that is launched to the ISS. I thought it was the awesome-set elective ever. Then, i saw this thread and started crying.
I want this to be a thing at my school so much.

> 
> Back when I was in 8th grade, we didn't have these fancy video programs to simulate a space program. All we could do was count down from 10 and throw rocks as high in the air as we could. The rocks usually didn't make it into orbit, and they regularly fell back down and hit one of us in the head. Space travel was rough back then.

Rocks? We used little brothers... and sisters too til mom put an end to that. Still, I wonder where Robby is now?

I wish I could retire now and start a club like that, it actually sounds like fun.

Wow... Why haven't I thought about that?

Probably I can go to my school and ask if they will allow me to lead a "physics afterclass" for those interested in this, where I will tell them the mathematical and physical basis of spaceflight, and hen we will be able to check their solutions on practice...

I teach physics and, while I haven't directly used KSP in my classes, a lot of the example problems I use are, shall we say, inspired by my experience with KSP.

Today I walked a group of students through deriving the Tsiolkovsky Rocket Equation (you know, the one we use to calculate Ã¢Ë†â€ v available) from scratch. Good times.
Why can't MY school have this? No fair ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)
Back in my day we had to make do with a model rocket club. The computer club got to play with Apple II's

Im glad this is a thing.

I remember there were similar things for me back in middle school, that's what got me started in scale model building, the experience from which I then took to building RC models.

Im sure for some kids this will be their first experience in what will become a lifelong hobby/interest.
The cool thing is, next year, KSP will still be in active development, with new stuff added every few months! At least that seems to be Squad's plan.
WHAT!!! No fair as well ![;.;](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cry.gif)
